metadata.title: CVE-2019-9458 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in the video driver there is a use after free due toa race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1037-kvm - 4.4.0-1037.43
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1072-aws - 4.4.0-1072.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1100-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1100.108
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1104.109

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-139.165').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1037.43').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1072.82').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.108').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.109').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
